intro: Auriculardisia acutata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed auriculardisia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural collections.
